subject: AI & Agents
title: Open Source vs Closed Models
description: A 60-second lesson on Open Source vs Closed Models.

hook.text: Meta releases Llama for free. OpenAI keeps GPT-4's weights locked. Both strategies have merit.

buildup.text: Open-source models let anyone inspect, modify, and deploy them. Closed models are API-only.

discovery.text: Open models drive research, customization, and privacy. Closed models lead in raw capability.

twist.text: Open models can be fine-tuned to remove safety guardrails â€” a double-edged sword.

climax.text: The open-source community is closing the gap fast. Llama 3 rivals GPT-3.5 in many tasks.

punchline.text: The best model depends on what you need: power or freedom.

quiz.question: What is a risk of open-source AI models?
options: They can be modified to remove safety guardrails
They are always less capable than closed models
They can only run on specific hardware
